channel.title: Need help with rune evo v3 i really need help with this please someone help me
channel.description: Need help with rune evo v3 i get this error when i run it and then the npcs dont respawn "ERROR! THREAD NAME: main java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "5505 " at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at com.rs.utils.NPCSpawns.loadSpawns(NPCSpawns.java:35) at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:90) Guardian is now Online (Port: 43596, Launch Time: 6.515s) " :mad: its probally something really easy but this is really annoying because i cant figure this out :palm: https://www.dropbox.com/s/dp4thm59nqux9xm/Screenshot%202014-03-28%2020.31.09.png

item.title: Need help with rune evo v3 i really need help with this please someone help me

item.title: Need help with rune evo v3 i really need help with this please someone help me
item.dc:creator: @MirroredGaming MirroredGaming
item.description:
@MirroredGaming wrote:

Pure_:

NPCSpawns.java line 35. Before you use Integer.parseInt(something) do Integer.parseInt(something.trim()).

i changed it to this int x = Integer.parseInt(split[1].trim());
and i got this error
ERROR! THREAD NAME: main
org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelException: Failed to bind to: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:43596
at org.jboss.netty.bootstrap.ServerBootstrap.bind(ServerBootstrap.java:298)
at com.rs.net.ServerChannelHandler.(ServerChannelHandler.java:50)

at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:89)

Caused by: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketPipelineSink.bind(NioServerSocketPipelineSink.java:138)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketPipelineSink.handleServerSocket(NioServerSocketPipelineSink.java:90)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketPipelineSink.eventSunk(NioServerSocketPipelineSink.java:64)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.Channels.bind(Channels.java:569)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.AbstractChannel.bind(AbstractChannel.java:187)
at org.jboss.netty.bootstrap.ServerBootstrap$Binder.channelOpen(ServerBootstrap.java:343)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.Channels.fireChannelOpen(Channels.java:170)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketChannel.(NioServerSocketChannel.java:80)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketChannelFactory.newChannel(NioServerSocketChannelFactory.java:158)

Use the String#trim function before attempting conversion. The space in the string is breaking it.

does that help at all the new link?

[/quote]I told you to use String#trim on the input before trying to convert it into an integer.[/quote]
